info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 5:12AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BANDS... HAZARDS...Bands of heavy snow, which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile, were impacting the region. These bands of moderate to locally heavy snow are producing snowfall rates of up to one inch per hour. Up to two inches of new snowfall is possible by 7 AM. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 508 AM EST, bands of heavy snow were located across the Mohawk and Schoharie Valleys, Capital Region, Sacandaga Area and the Lake George Saratoga Region. These bands are slowly shifting eastward. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Albany, Schenectady, Troy, Clifton Park, Rotterdam, Saratoga Springs, Amsterdam, Cohoes, Gloversville, Glens Falls, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Johnstown, Colonie, Herkimer, Scotia, Hudson Falls, Mechanicville, Little Falls and Cobleskill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 9 and 30. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 23 and 7, and between exits 8A and 25. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
